events.name: Open for business! Mystery speaker and mystery food!

venue.name: Cuyahoga County Public Library - Independence Branch

events.description:
This is the grand kickoff of GDG Cleveland! The speaker and topic are TBD but the real reason to be here is the networking (and the free food)!

We expect people from all over the Cleveland Tech-verse from specialists in applications for mobile, back end, .NET, UX design, web, Firebase, Cloud and many more.

Come on out and "cross pollinate" with tech-makers from all over Cleveland.

*Google and GDG Cleveland are both serious about promoting diversity in tech; including Women in Tech, the disabled, economically disadvantaged and others. We have an "absolute zero" policy toward bigotry, misogyny and any other form of harassment based on sexual orientation, nationality, religion, gender of birth or choice or anything else we missed here.
events.how_to_find_us: We're in the large meeting room.

events.name: Shooting for the Cloud!
events.description:
We got our Cloud speaker!

Ron Runyon has spent the last 5 years as a Senior Developer with Onix, focusing on Google Cloud technologies. Ron has primarily been a java developer, has 12 year experience developing on the web and been working in python for the last year.

Doug Sainato is with Onix's Cloud Solutions team in Lakewood and he's also volunteered to take time out of his personal life to be with us this Thursday!

Thanks guys!

Onix Networking bills themselves as the Leading Cloud Services Provider and is one of Google Cloud's largest and oldest partners. They've been a Google partner since 2002, are based in Lakewood and work with everything Google Cloud. Their areas of expertise include GCP, Maps, Google Search, G Suite, Chrome and all the application development around those platforms.

Google Cloud offers a plethora of solutions for businesses and provides services that can help you take advantage of opportunities you wouldn't have without it.
events.how_to_find_us: Go left around the back of the building. Walk in, turn left, it's the theater on the left.

events.name: Flutter Live! (Remote Watch Party)

venue.name: Cuyahoga County Public Library - Independence Branch

events.description:
Flutter Live! is the biggest event from the Flutter team yet! Live from London, the event and "whatever announcement they might make" will be at 12:00 local time because it's the best time slot to be able to include everyone from the West Coast all the way to Eastern Europe, South America and more.

Here is the link for this shared event in the GDG Cleveland group: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Cleveland/events/255477547/

There's a rumor this might be a huge event to launch Flutter 1.0; but it might just be a big birthday party for Tim Sneath, so why knows?

Note: Due to expected low turn out at noon on a Tuesday we're going to run this as a joint meeting with GDG Cleveland, our new GDG that is also here on Meetup.

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: We're in the larger of the two meeting rooms.

events.name: Flutter 1.0 is Here! And Flutter is now for Desktop too!
events.description:
My apologies to all, this meeting has been scheduled for some time. I had posted it to this group and another group and, for some reason, the other group is the only one it was showing up for.

We do have a meeting this Thursday!

Flutter v1.0 has arrived, so it's time to get people started with Flutter 101 +Plus!

Many developers and businesses have said that they were going to wait until v1.0 to be released before they were going to try Flutter, so now the excuses are gone! In addition to being stable for mobile, Google has officially announce they will be putting resources into perfecting Flutter on all desktops, which has already been pioneered by the Flutter Community for several months now.

And then there is Hummingbird.

If you haven't heard, the Hummingbird project is taking the Flutter apps you already write for mobile and desktop, and is putting them on the web too! Write your code once, deploy literally everywhere! Mobile, desktop and web!

So come on down for Flutter 101 +Plus, a 101 that goes into some of the best tips for how to avoid roadblocks in the Flutter learning curve, such as the dreaded "RenderFlex" errors, "Unlimited bounds" and "Infinite height" headaches.

There will be food! Suggestions for what we should have are welcome, but please keep in mind that if Google doesn't offer to help cover the expenses then we may be taking up a collection.

See you there!

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam and FREE Qwiklabs access!
events.description:
Limit: 45 Attendees

Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and an additional 30 days of access to the training platform to compete any labs you want!

Bring a laptop and don't forget your charger! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers but the sites do work best with Firefox or Chrome.

See you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Drive around the building to the left and enter through the back (North) main doors. Take the hallway to the left, we're in the theater on the left side of the hallway.

events.name: Nevercode: CI as Smooth as Flutter

venue.name: Cuyahoga County Public Library - Independence Branch

events.description:
Nevercode has been building its CI/CD service with mobile developers in companies like Toyota, Sainsburys and Walmart. Recently we released two new products - Codemagic and Testmagic. Codemagic is a dedicated CI/CD service for Flutter and Testmagic is a free app, written in Flutter to distribute your builds to testers and collect feedback.

Part 1:

In the first part of the meetup we will give a brief introduction to Flutter and Continuous integration. Most of the sessions will focus on testing with Flutter and practical example of common practice of setting up CI with Codemagic for your Flutter project.

Part 2:

Part 2 will go more technical and cover specific use cases when integrating your CI/CD project with third party services like crashlytics and firebase. We will showcase how developers have been using Codemagic and some of the most common custom scripts that are being used.

Codemagic is a dedicated CI, which means we only support Flutter. How does this affect our build times compared to a CI that supports apps written in react native, cordova and ionic for example? We’ve got some statistics to highlight the differences.

--------------------------

Speaker: Mikhail Tokarev, Devops engineer at Nevercode

Mikhail has worked as devops engineer for over 5 years. He is passionate about introducing devops practices into development process in different teams. He joined Nevercode over a year ago and now leads architecture design of both Nevercode and Codemagic. He first saw Flutter in 2018 after Droidcon in Berlin and is excited about helping mobile developers around the world with seamless CI/CD experiences.
events.how_to_find_us: Go in the main entrance and then turn to the left.

events.name: Google I/O Extended!
events.description:
Google I/O Extended events are focused on bringing the local developer community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions.

Please respond here to let us know which recorded talk you would like to see at the event. Anything with a camera icon on it should be available at the time of our event. See what there is, let us know what you want to see and we hope to see you there!

https://events.google.com/io/schedule/events/
events.how_to_find_us: Go around the left side of the building, the entrance is around back. Once inside, take a left at the fountain and we're in the second meeting room on the left (the theater).

organizers.name: Scott S.
organizers.bio: Flutter Speaker, Workshop Presenter and Bootstrap Training. Liaison between the Flutter Community and Google. Co-Founder, Flutter Study Group Slack. Co-Creator: The Flutter Zone Podcast (due in June). Get your Flutter Swag at: https://bit.ly/2kcpCdH

group_profile.intro: Greetings! My name is Scott. I'm an author, speaker, and workshop presenter who spends most of his time working with Flutter. I'm also an organizer of GDG Cleveland, our new Google Developer Group for the Cleveland/Akron area.
